intro: Thlaspi andicola, commonly known as the Andean cabbages, is a species of flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the Andes Mountains in South America, where it thrives in high-altitude environments. The plant is characterized by its rosette growth form and small, capsule-like fruits. It has hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Thlaspi andicola is adapted to cold climates and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
